name: Pool Nation
description: Play POOL NATION and become mesmerised by our balls, entranced by our decals & unashamedly attached to our cues, so join us please, & just have fun playing pool!! WARNING: contains addictive content!! Pool Nation, with WORKSHOP integration AVAILABLE NOW in our Crazy Mode the Box Of Tricks (Out Now)!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, SP3/WINDOWS VISTA SP2/WINDOWS 7 Processor: Dual Core, AMD/INTEL 2.6 GHZ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB OF VIDEO MEMORY ATI RADEON X1600/NVIDIA GEFORCE 7600/INTEL HD 2000 OR HIGHER DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: This is without a doubt the best pool game for PC i've ever played. You can play 9-ball, 8-ball and a bunch of minigames like killer, straight, etc. Both single and multi are super fun modes. What is more, two DLCs (box of tricks and snooker) are coming while I'm writing this review.   To sum up, if you like pool you must check out this game!

One of the best pool sim to come along since the Virtual pool series. The developers are a small group working out of Manchester, England and they do a whale of a job listening to their players. They frequent all of the forum and community hub sites and update when needed. They really do care about their product and want to make it the best sim on the market and to my opinion they have succeeded. This game is a really 'must have' for the serious and not so serious pool gamer. Cheap and twice the price but well worth looking into...buy this game!
Easily the best pool game on Steam.
The best pool game ive ever played.  Easy controls, graphics are beautiful. Physics are spot-on. This game is just amazing.
Great Game! Nice Physics, Control and Optics!!!

Pool Nation is one of the most polished indie games of 2013- the animations are shiny and smooth, the gameplay is responsive and the physics are realistic. You won't find yourself screaming at this game for bouncing your balls in the wrong direction, or glitching out and dropping your cue ball through the table. With eleven game modes including tournaments, online play, and single-player endurance mode; as well as a slew of collectables to unlock, Pool Nation has no shortage of goodies to keep gameplay fresh.  The single player component revolves primarily around tournaments where you take on AI challengers of ever increasing difficulty. Each match has an associated list of challenges, and completing them unlocks a variety of cosmetic changes like cues and balls. Standard games like 9 ball are present along with more interesting options like Golf, which challenges you to put specific balls into specific pockets. There’s also a time attack style mode, where balls spawn on the table and you have to sink as many as possible in the time limit. There are Free Play, Versus, and Online modes present too, but I had a hard time finding anyone to challenge online.  Pool Nation is a great looking game that features bright and shiny graphics that makes each game, literally, feel new and different. There are some good themes on the game's soundtrack, and though the game's controls look difficult to use, they aren't difficult to learn. There are also options that can be easily turned on or off to give players assists in a game including arrows that point at the next balls that need to be hit or arrows that show where a ball will travel when hit. All of these features combine to make an excellent presentation for Pool Nation.   But is it fun? In short stints I definitely enjoyed playing the game, but it isn’t the type of thing I’d want to play for hours at a time. Having said that, I think Pool Nation is the kind of experience that would be a hit at a house party. If you’ve been searching far and wide for a Billiards simulator, and don’t have room for an actual table, Pool Nation is probably the solution. The physics are solid, the controls allow for extreme fine tuning of shots, and everything looks super shiny. A few more game types would be welcome, but for $10 Pool Nation is the gold standard in the category.         Pool Nation - Gameplay Demo

Hey guys, thanks for reading my reviews. Let me make this as plain as possible. If you like pool and can find this cheap, check it out. It's not bad at all. I think the controls are better here in many ways than I've seen in previous PC pool games, but what's the game really like? You get nine ball, eight ball, and a few mini-games. There is a trick mode that hasn't been put into the game yet apparently. The humor is painful mostly, but not always bad. Just never very clever or subtle.  As for the negative stuff: I think it gets repetitious. It's also buggy. I don't like the AI at all, as it sometimes seems too transparent what's happening in the game. Some of the rounds a really good AI player will goof several times in a row to give me a chance to beat it. Other times it feels like it's cheating to win. Sometimes the match challenges don't appear to count properly or are too literally applied, and it seems inconsistant with its application of what meets the requirements of a given challenge. For example, I played a match that wanted me to get a 3 ball streak with a jump shot. I got a 4 ball streak with a jump at the end and it didn't count it. The next time I played, it seemed to count it. So I just don't trust the AI at all. Also, some of the designer ball sets that you can unlock confuse me visually because the stripes and solids look too similar to me from a distance. The settings are very colorful, which isn't necessarily bad, but can be VERY loud.   Anyway, even though this seems a negative review, it's not meant to be. The devs say they are working to improve it, and if they do I think it has a lot of potential. As it is, if you can get it for a very low price and you like pool, try it. I've enjoyed playing it, but it can be frustrating at times.
Very good game buy it now!! 6/5
Pool game of my dreams!
simple gameplay. overall, not bad. 7/10

First off, this is the best looking pool game I have ever played. Period. Beautiful pool tables, balls, and environments that are fully fleshed out and animated to give you a real sense of immersion.  The game is full of details that kept surprising me. Some of them are so subtle that you can't even notice it unless you are watching the replay. Here are a few things you will find:  * 3rd dimension: this isn't a simple pool game where balls stick to the table. All pool balls can be knocked off, up in the air, and over other balls (given enough force). * When hit certain ways, chalk will fall off stick and sprinkle on the table. * Tiny woven texture on table material when you zoom in close * Sides of table (bumpers) actually give and bend in when a ball hits them with force (very hard to notice without replay!)  For single player there is enough to keep you busy for awhile with tournaments in various game types against different AI. One thing I found keeping my interest is bonuses you can try for on each game in a tournament. For instance one might have a bonus for pulling off a jump shot during the match. You can still win the game, but there will be a bonus for doing the jump shot. Earning these stars while winning makes for a fun challenge. There are also many ball styles, cue sticks, and locations to unlock through single player. So far every ball set I have unlocked has been great looking and is a good incentive to keep playing and unlock more.  For multiplayer, it is fully functional in both same computer and online play. Unsurprisingly you have to wait awhile for a game to show up, but that's less the fault of the game and more of the popularity of online pool :).  Last I should go over the physics. This is a tough point to argue because so many factors go into pool physics and without a doubt there is no game out there that is 100% accurate. If you have ever seen a ball hit another ball at high speed in close up slow motion you'll see what I mean. Not to mention there are many different ball sizes/weight, table materials and cue sticks used in different areas that add to the difficulty in comparing this to the real world.  All I can say for sure is the physics seem real and have been really fun. Added to the ability to hit the ball just where I want at power levels I never could in RL the game makes you feel like a pool master.  Game is on sale for $1.99 currently. Sell a couple summer trading cards and pick it up!

If you like Pool, you are going to like this. The physics alone are impressive, allowing you to put a spin on the cue ball to curve left, right, or even go backwards with a back spin. The Box of Tricks mode isn't in as of this writing but it should be availible soon. It's a great game to play if you just want to chill out, turn off the music and listen to music of your own.
Good game - easy to pick up. Played Pure Pool, but this is better.
It's pool.
Well I liked, this game is not the best but it's good
I never knew a pool game could look so awesome and be so slick. Really accessible, great casual game, online, multi or single player.

Great game! Picked it up on sale for $2.99 and it is easily worth more. Physics are great, graphics are great for what this game is and there is plenty to do. Pool Nation is a great time killer. All in all, if you don't have it, grab it now and save some $$ in the process!

extremely impressed by this game! it's an incredibly in depth pool game, with lots of potential for insane shots/tricks, but is still very open to newer players. despite being an extremely in depth game, it is a very nice game to just play mindlessly and relax. the soundtrack is also very smooth and relaxing. not to mention, the game looks incredible. totally recommend this game
I never knew a pool game could look so awesome and be so slick. Really accessible, great casual game, online, multi or single player.
Really fun game with amazing visuals and physics.
If you like 8 ball pool I'm pretty sure this is the only one on steam. It looks very pretty and has good controls. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys pool, or thinks they might.

Very nice pool game, even fun to play alone vs AI  Singleplayer has: Tutorial, box of trickshots (or something) 4x 9-ball tours, 4x 8-ball tours  Tours include certain ammount of AI matches. Each match can give you 1-3 stars. Usually you get 1 star by winning match which also unlocks next match and then other stars you get when doing certain task during the match (you still need to win the match also)  Tasks like: Perform comboshot during match or kickshot or get streak of 7 balls in match + much of other stuff like that.  Also getting 2 stars in certain matches will unlock bonus match in that tour. Each tour contain few bonus match to unlock.  I have completed first 9-ball tour by 71% and it took me 6 hours, so if other tours take as much time it means total 48h of gameplay and still you havent compeleted everything by 100%, so this game has plenty of nice singleplayer content for your money.  Totally recommend this game but be warned: Multiplayer is dead, so dont buy it for online multiplayer
Awesome game. Good physics, simple controls, different game modes, simple customizations. For a pool game, it kicks ♥♥♥. Worth buying. Especially if you get it for a friend.
hell yea, loads of fun.

For a billiards game, its actually quite good, with tons of customatization options. graphics are really great, many gamemodes to choose from...  PROS:  -lots of customatization -Many gamemodes, Normal types like 8 or 9 ball, or fun types like Killer, Straight, and Golf. -Graphics, really shiny and realistic -Slo-Mo -Trick shots -The tiny particles of acrylic that fly off the Cue ball in Slo-Mo when you hit it hard. -Native Xbox 360 controller support  Cons: -The physics might be exaggerated a little bit, so you can make awesome trick shots, so if you'r looking for a '100% super realistic,' Pool game, pass on this one.
High level of detail, realistic ball physics. quite enjoyable.
My god, this game is a lot of fun. Good, simple, pool physics. For maximum fun, turn off the guidelines. I think they make it a bit too easy.

This game while FUN, is currently MASSIVELY broken. sometimes balls will just stop hovering over the pocket's edge, where in the real world the ball would have gone down. sometimes the middle pockets throw you out even though it completely went down the pocket.. spin on the cue ball is rediculous and inaccurate to say the least, the ball just does crazy things.. and the Aim Assist is either too much help, or completely useless in the hardest setting before no aim assist.

This game seems worth the sale price of less than two dollars. I would have been angry if I had spent more. Once the motion sickness fades from trying to position a shot while the mouse simultaniously moves the view I'll try to play again.
nice graphics and phisics, lots of game modes

Looks gorgeous, lots of characters to play against and great challenges. It's one of those games that makes you feel good about how good you've got. Personally, I find lots of beer helps too. Back in the 00's (yes, I'm that old), I used to love Virtual Pool 3 (which I can't get to run on any platform now), and, after a drought of many years, this has filled the void. I'd change a couple of things, mainly that you could lock your X-axis when your shooting (but this is mitigated by the 'fine-tune' key) and I change the power meter thing to a mouse-mapped power (a-la VP3) but apart from that, it's a great pool game. I'd have to put a shout out for the artwork two, the stylised characters and their back stories is awesome (and it does it all without slam zooms and star wipes)e. If you've got a hint of imagination, you don't feel like you're playing against some artifically levelled AI (even though you are). Well done Cherry Pop (now fix the X-axis lock *claps hands* make it so!)  Oh, one other thing, the menu system is horrible, could really do with an overhaul. Thank God you don't have to use it that much!
I have played nearly 7 hours of this game... It's obviously pretty gr8
good pool game shame no english rules tho added for online playing but apart from that one the best pool games ive played
REALLY good if you like pool. Great Graphics amazing physics great single play. even BETTER if you have friends that also have the game. its really good. its worth the 10.00$
Best virtual pool game that I played online. The physics are spot on and the graphics are stunning. Really impressed ... only more people in online games and it will be even more awesome !

A surprisingly entertaining pool game. Although its large list of controls might seem confusing, they are well explained within the games tutorials. I have had endless fun with this funny and entertaining game! A nice, relatively cheap game!

An outstandingly simple but well-executed game, Pool Nation does one thing but it does it very very well. Actually, that's not really accurate, because there are a great many components of the game that work seamlessly together, including the lobby, multiplayer connection, freeplay for practicing for a no-stress way to improve your game, and a wry sense of humor. The ability to play on your own in the lobby while waiting for friends to connect is one example of a small feature that makes a world of difference.  The other wonderful thing has been the active and friendly development staff who have been available online to answer questions, address bugs, and take suggestions for improvements and changes. All in all a wonderful effort at a great price, and I hope the devs are able to continue to support it and continue bringing their level of quality control to their next game.
Love this game, realistic and fun. Love the difficulty range. Wish online wasn't completely dead.

This game is really good. If you like pool the you already like this game. Its on sale of .99c right now. Its valued at 10.00! You will not regret this purchase.   Join the  community group   to play with all the pro's.
Love this game, realistic and fun. Love the difficulty range. Wish online wasn't completely dead.
Very fun game indeed!
Got it for 69p ;3

It's pool... there's not much more i can say

I like this game alot. It lacks a bit of the old time sleazy pool-hall atmosphere, which, to me is a big part of the game. The settings are a little too modern for me but having said that, the game is solid. I like the aiming system and the AI players really need to be kept at bay or on the higher levels, they will run the table even though they can miss some very easy shots but like humans, they just plain miss now and then. I have not tried the trick shots much so I can not speak about those but if you just want to play some decent 8 or 9 ball, get this. It sells pretty cheap too. It just needs some snooker ! Oh, and some more pub-like settings. I want to hear my mates swearing in the background :)  Note, there are many complaints now about the devs abandoning the game and not updating in a bit so if that is an issue for you, take heed.
A great pool game (with snooker being added soon) with fantastic physics, great graphics, and it's just great fun. Would definately recommend, even if you don't like pool.
Funny Game if you need a break from studying for 5 Minutes (like myself ^^)
This game's cheap (when it's on sale), quite good looking, has nice pool mechanic.  Be reminded to buy the 'Complete' copy, though, as it saves you money in the long run.
it's a neat game  except for the cheating AI.
A great pool game (with snooker being added soon) with fantastic physics, great graphics, and it's just great fun. Would definately recommend, even if you don't like pool.
probably the best PC pool videogames out there and when on sale for $0.99 a must have :)

Walk in to their yards at night and urinate, bleach and deuce in their brand new sparkling 48m2 water paradise then be questioned by police officers in the morning only to decieve them by putting all the blame on your son little Jimmy.

This is 3D pool and amazing graphics. I like the atmosphere. There's a ton of techniques you can learn and practice. All in all, a good game to play when the mood fits.

Seriously has the physics of real pool. I should know as I play pool for real. Get it. It is 10 bucks, it's cheap as hell. If anyone buys this, hit me up. So we can play. No one seriously is just not in the Online lobby. I don't get why. I just don't.
Awesome game tons of fun..

This is a very well done game. Presentation, graphics, gameplay, BALL PHYSICS (still cant nail the Knife's Edge shot yet). A lot to dive into but easy enough to pick up. This is a great game for time-wasting. Be ware, 1 game can turn into 1 hour's worth of games.   Also, I can't pass up the opportunity to talk about shiny balls. My God, those balls are super shiny.

I love this game. Worth the 10 bucks. But I have one big problem with this game. No one plays this ♥♥♥♥er online. Other then that, this is the ultimate Billiards PC experience. Seriously has the physics of real pool. I should know as I play pool for real. Get it. It is 10 bucks, it's cheap as hell. If anyone buys this, hit me up. So we can play. No one seriously is just not in the Online lobby. I don't get why. I just don't.
trickshot simulator 2014, would buy again  10/10

I love billards in general and this is a good virtual form. Easy to get used to, easy to play and fun in short doses (tends to get boring after a while just like real pool) Only problem is in single player the AI ramps up from cant sink a shot in the begining but by the second touny the AI pretty much never misses, by the Third YOU CANT MISS A SINGLE SHOT, so the learning curve is more of a cliff, and as for the online matches I think I'm the only person on Steam who owns this game as I have never seen a single multiplayer match or a single person ever online... Customize your balls and cue (but who cares really)... all in all not a bad game if you can get it for cheap (I got it for 2.99), certainaly better than online flash based pool, but not by all that much considering it's still just billards...

Slow down and rewind time with the replay system which lets you review the action close up. Take on skilled virtual opponents in the career modes, unlocking new balls, locations, and cues. Play other users around the world on Xbox LIVE, with single matches and tournaments. Get hooked on the challenging Endurance mode, a frantic pot-against-the clock game which promises to keep you coming back for more

Nice game! the music is chill, the physics are solid and it's a nice relaxing break that you can pick up and put down at your own pace. Perfect kind of game for multiplayer. Play solo against the computer, play online or share a computer with a buddy and play hotseat. (a simple feature too few games have) This is one of my go-to games for when a friend comes over with some beers and we're hanging. Definitely well worth the price!

Pool nation is a team based fps that if you dont have a healer you are probably going to lose. I like to play 3v3 since i only have 3 friends therefore i have other people i can communicate with. If you cannot communicate with your teammate you are bound to lose, since you will need to get health and ammo from your supports. All around great game and would recommend it to anyone that likes basketball and football but if you like tennis then u will hate this game. <3
Great pool game! Nothing to say..
I had to choose between poop or pool. I chose wrong, my pants are soiled.
Very nice game !
A very nice pool game with interesting challenges. The thing I like the most is the 2D and 3D camera view and the fact that you can adjust the aiming aid and even turn it off.
well then

Good game, plays just like the real thing, great physics, beautiful graphics, several play modes, trick shots etc.  Well worth the price, astounding deal when on sale.  If you like pool, get this to play with friends.

Gameplay: 9/10 Sounds: 8/10 Multiplayer: 10/10 Graphics: 10/10  Additional Comments: + Stunning graphics + Great artwork + Lots of customization + Spot on sound effects - Lack of character voice makes everyone seem like robots  9/10

If you like billiards then this is by far the best one on steam.  It's missing some things here and there (like call pocket when sinking the 8 ball) but the workshop trick section is pretty neat, and it definitely breathes life into an otherwise stale genre.

I recommend this game to anyone that use to play Cool Pool/Maximum Pool !!!! It is great but one thing is missing in this game :( & that is a lobby for online play but other then that it beats the old Cool pool/Maximum Pool hands down
Fun game, easy to pick up and play. Nice time killer.
great game a*

this game has to be the best pool sim i've played to date. great graphics, relaxing soundtrack, and calming gameplay that can improve your game on the felt. what more needs to be said? 10/10 Strongly Recommended
OMGPOP is gone, this is the next best.

Most realistic physics engine in any cue sport game that I've played. It really is quite impressive, you can pull off just about any shot you can imagine if you have the know how. The AI players start off easy enough for you to get used to the control scheme (which isn't actually that intuitive, but once you get used to it, it's pretty damn good) and the game in general, and they range up to players so hard that if you give them an opportunity, they will clear almost any table. For some, that may be off putting, but it's not too far from reality, a lot of top players will clear almost any table if theyre having a good day.  Only issue i have really is that after a while, it gets kinda dull. Caning each AI player one after the other gets too easy after a while, and the only way to lose is to try and get 3 stars for the 3 challenges per match, but providing they don't ask you to do something that actually requires any thought, like a bank or kick shot, you have no excuse not to get all 3 stars.  They also try and spice it up with bonus matches of different disciplines of pool, which again is cool for a while, I still haven't mastered them all.   I don't really know what to suggest to make it better, it's pretty much as good as I can imagine a pool game getting, barring adding some kind of trick shot challenge, but then again, you may aswell make all shots a trick shot once you're used to the game.   8/10 - A very good time killer

Normally, I wouldn't post a review about this sort of game, but, the tutorials in this game made me able to perform a jump shot, and a nifty curve shot tonight while I was playing pool at the bar.  9/10. Awesome Pool game.

For some reason this game keeps crashing atleast once EVERY time I play it. And if you alt+tab out of the game, I cant alt+tab back in and I either have to alt+f4 to close it, or it crashes to desktop on its own...  Other then that, its a REALLY good pool game, I feel it should have had snooker aswell to make it a complete game. But if you like pool games, this is the one to get.

The game itself is great - 3 out of 5 stars - but the major quip I'm having right now is the inability to record without the game crashing, and the inability to alt-tab out of the game, then alt-tabbing back into the game (or choosing it on the taskbar) as it does nothing force me to alt-ctrl-del and have to shut down the game through the task manager to restore mouse movement and overall functionality of my system.  With that out of the way - graphics are phenominal, producing realistic simulation and textures while maintaining a high FPS which is something you seldom see in most games anymore - even with an Intel Chipset.  Gameplay flows smoothly, with the ability to choose how much you want to see for aiming your cueball at your target ball - be it with Novice and seeing the extended trail of the cueball and target ball, through several higher tier aiming difficulties that shorten this trail, or disabling it completely for a more realistic grasp of the game. Of course with aiming turned off you'll have issues with performing trickshots, but if you're able to line up your shots, why would you want to perform a trickshot in the first place?  Windows 7 Ultimate Intel Graphics 4000 HD 4GB RAM
It's just pool. If you like pool, you'll like this game. Could use having more features though.
Brilliant and addictive pool game
Fun Enough. I did not expect the control will be so smooth on my 360 controller. WEll done chery pop

Pool Nation is a your run-of-the-mill billiards with impressive physics and graphics.  I haven't played pool since I was at a christmas party with my relatives back around 2007, and playing this type of game brought back some nostalgia for me.  This was my first in a very long time playing a billiards video game, and I'm talking a  looong  time...like around when Sega Genesis was still new and Sonic 3 hasn't even come out. I think I was only...what, five years old during the time?  In any case, the controls took some getting used to, but after about 10 minutes into playing '9 Ball', everything felt natural.  The camera angles give a nice sense of realism, and if adjusted correctly, you feel as if you're holding the pool stick yourself and hitting the target...with psychic eyes in seeing guidelines.  The physics in this game felt just right for me, where like real pool, speed and precision matter when banking shots, as well as how you plan to hit the ball, such as curving and hopping.  The graphics added a nice sense of realism to the game, and the crisp clear look on each ball gave the game a nice type of brilliance. The only thing I question is that every ball has a reflection, which is very awkward to me, since I know actual billiard balls aren't that reflective in real life. But I'm being anal at that point, and you might as well add scratches to the balls and pool table, and make the atmosphere bleak.  Yeah, that's  real  pool right there, but I'm digressing at this point.  Overall, with the different types of modes in the game, and the option to play with a friend or online, this game is pretty solid, and I would recommend this game to any of my friends that want to play a billiards game without the need of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ off pool owners for scratching up the leather.

If you like billiards then this is by far the best one on steam.  It's missing some things here and there (like call pocket when sinking the 8 ball) but the workshop trick section is pretty neat, and it definitely breathes life into an otherwise stale genre.
Not a bad game I like the controls.
A surprisingly addictive pool-game. Thats all it is, and its very good at it! It looks very good, feels good and are easy to understand but hard to master.
Great game, both in single and in multiplayer!
Great game all tho the multiplayer is dead
You hustlin' me, boy?
hard to play on alaptop without a mouse.

Fun game and challenging enough. Achievements haven't popped for me though and the trick shot stuff is a bit naff. Would like more free rein with that if possible.

If you wish you were good at real pool, this is the game you've been waiting for. Ace the tournaments, and show off your superhuman aiming skills. Or challenge a friend and see who is better. Variety of ways to play, and grand fun however you do it!

This game is simply GREAT, if you have any attraction to pool it would be worth having even with quarter of the stuff it has.   (OTOH be careful, on my wife's notebool it crashes consistently so can't be played there at all, on mine it was rock stable.)
I love this game. Excellent virtual substitute for IRL pool.

Although the physics is inferior to World Snooker Championship series and the game crashes when using Alt+Tab, I still recommend this game as the best modern pool game on the PC. It has plenty of single player challenges and tournaments, and the tutorials are very useful in real life too. If you are looking for the multiplayer action I must say I had trouble finding opponents when I restricted aiming help, but if you allow novice aiming help you will find an opponent in no time and it plays very nice.
Fantastic game - decent realism too - highly recommend
We Love to play this game together :)
Reminds me of the old virtual pool and how much I enjoyed that game

Its a Billard game, if you don't like billards then you won't like this game. With that said it is a fairly competent Billards game for being a Billards game. It's showing you what will happen lines in many cases make it a touch bit easy, though the lines should be there, maybe not as far out as they go after the cue hits the first ball or rail. With that said the pyhsics in the game seem good, you can actually do some pretty neat trick shots if you know what your doing.  All in all, unless your really into Billards you will not find $10 of value here, its a good game to pick up if you like billards with fairly realistic physics when it is on sale, but I can not recommend it for people who only like Billards at full price, not because the game is bad in anyway but because well a video game version of pool no matter how good it is is still a somewhat niche market. So if you find it on sale and can pick it up for $3-5, even if you only like pool I would say its worth it. If your really into pool, then even $10 is worth it, but don't come expecting anything other then a competent pool game with good physics because apart from unlocking new table skins, ball skins, and stick skins its 'tournaments' might as well just be single match games because even if you loose to someone you can just retry them.  Just as a warning I did have the game crash on me once when doing a trick shot, so it may not be fully stable, but enjoyable Billard game non the less.
is there a way to change graphics in this game? im using a Cinema HD display. the graphics are horrible.
My play time speaks for itself.
Polished Pool game that is a blast to play! Pick it up cheapos!

This is a superb pool game! There are quite a few tournaments to play against the AI in, which opens new Cues, balls and a selection of table baize. There are also different styles of Pool, 8 or 9 ball as well as free play and the AI Tournaments. Does a decent job of showing how to pull of each type of shot and, through the bonus levels, makes you practice to get all those stars ;-)  The AI is good, varies in ability and gives a decent challenge as you work through the Tournaments. There is a pretty good Hot-seat Multi-player mode as well as Online Multi-player as well so you can play against others if you bore of the computer.  The game is very pretty, well made without any bugs that I've come across and plays very smoothly. I'd heartily suggest this to anyone who likes to play Pool, and many who are open to trying it out. Good game indeed.
You get to hit a ball with a stick. You got yourself a real winner there. 10/10
MUST BUY, if you like Pool. A lot of fun, great physics and looks great.

Virtual Pool, Archer MacLean's Pool, both fantastic pool games; and then there's Pool Nation. It beats them both. It is the BEST pool game I've ever played. It has a few issues and sadly a rather low number of online players but the base game is amazing. It also looks stunning and it's easy to do really cool shots. Buy it, buy it, BUY IT!
on-point physics and the game itself is very colorful. quite enjoyable!

I stumble n this game per chance as I was not looking for a pool game, and it turnedout to be a good surprise. I recommend it if you have any interest in pool, even if this is not the case you might give it a chance especialy on sale.  + The game is very approachable even if you are not famliar with pool, thnaks to various level of aiming assistance and a decent tutorial explaining how to perform basic to trick shots, + The art direction and gfx is really cool and atmospheric, + There are various game modes and mini challenges to keep you entertained and to add variations, + good physics and believable smulation.
Pool Nation has stunning graphics. It plays well and is the best pool game I have played on pc. Very enjoyable game I recommend you buy and play this pool game.

It's hard to big-up a Pool game, but trust me when i say, its just sooo good.   Had my eye for this for several months, but for some reason, i never got around to buying it. I wish I had purchased this earlier.  The graphics are top drawer, the ball physics are spot on and the leaning curve is just right.  Despite being an older game, there is a busy online community and forum and the devs just published an update - that tells you all you need to know doesnt it?.  If youre still on this page then stop dawdling and buy it!  Rack-em up.
Great pool game
Great physics, and delightful classic gameplay~
Literally the funniest game to play when drunk
Best game of pool ive ever played online. Challening but fun!! Addictive

Solid Physics. Online support for tournaments, ranked, and casual matches. Single player is full of different challenges.   Originally a game built for consoles, one should expect bugs and patches. Game has crashed twice. Even with the lack of plot, random bugs and small online community. This is a must buy if you love pool, love physics or want a new time sink.  Also, just as in real life, physics is beautiful and unforgiving. so practice practice practice.

I recommend this game to anyone that use to play Cool Pool/Maximum Pool !!!! It is great but one thing is missing in this game :( & that is a lobby for online play but other then that it beats the old Cool pool/Maximum Pool hands down

The best Billiards/Pool game by far. It's only pitfalls are the lack of online players and easy computer opponents. The core game modes are Nine Ball and Eight Ball, but more are coming soon. Plenty of unlockables too.
it's a good $3 pool game. if you want to play computer pool. waiting for loopty loops etc etc so i can play mini golf pool
some of the most beautiful balls i have ever seen.

A really great pool game with nice graphics, trick shots, and lots of nice unlockable felts, sticks and ball sets. I highly recommend it for any one who think they would like a virtual pool game. Includes standard 8 and 9 ball games as well as a few fun variant games. Also has man different a.i. to play against.

Good: Really decent pool sim for the price (especially the sale price it currently has)  The game has many cool modes and added extras to make it more interesting  Bad: Crashes really often (every half hour) Controller only picks up if you smash the A button during the intro/menu

Cool game, lovely graphics (though simple). The menu system is bizzare and frustrating until you get used to it, but the game itself is lovely.  I note that the game does allow Xbox360 controller, however is a pig to use, and you do not want to do this - use keyboard and mouse, and be happy.

Nice game. :) I'd love to play Pool in real life and this game makes me happy, because I can play pool everywhere, anytime. The graphic is good enough too. The only cons is the difficulty. Even for amateur, the AI is so easy to get beaten.
CMON! POOL IS COOL OKAY! GOTTA LOVE THOSE NEW AGE GRAPHICS DOE
Great pool game. Fantastic physics, great textures, great gameplay. So many pool games that i feel i should have paid tripple the price.
Pretty good game, but hard to find other online players to play against.

Cool game, lovely graphics (though simple). The menu system is bizzare and frustrating until you get used to it, but the game itself is lovely.  I note that the game does allow Xbox360 controller, however is a pig to use, and you do not want to do this - use keyboard and mouse, and be happy.
Bought it recently and not been able to get off it, such a good game!

If you think you like pool then you like this game. The trick shots you can pull off in this game provide a surprising satisfaction and the multiple locations, and skins for your pool cue and balls is just icing on the cake. Could maybe use some more game types. Hopefully the trick editor thing will fill that niche.
great game. never thought i'd play it as much as i do. great when you manage to find a random online match. the in game chat really stinks though. other than that, this games a winner.
the first time the AVG cried about a Steam game :DD
Absolutely great graphic and quite addicting.
Nice to play on a lan party with friends.
One of best games i ever played. recommended.
One of the best pool simulation games out there.
pool nataioon is great best pool simulator out there,need a snooker version please. well done.
Alright, i change my review since this game fixed. NO MORE MOUSE CURSOR APPEARS in game except in menu. Good job & thx to Dev,. Cheeerss....
This. Game. Is. Totally. WICKED! Seriously though, this game is great.
BETTER THEN 8BALLPOOL IN MINICLIP
Best Pool simiulator I have ever played.
literally no one ever to versus dissipointed on the online portion of the game
Go ahead and pot the white ball down a ton when you play without the aiming guide.

The graphics are great . The physics are decent . Plenty of game modes but lacking snooker game . The tables are fine but I wish they had more subtle customization.  All in all a decent video game that accomplishes its job as a pool game simulator but it could have been better .
Truely amazing.........   STUNNING quality
Best pool game I've seen/played. Looks great,and gameplay is realistic/tight. Perfect performance. Challenging AI in the later stages. Pick up on special for a few $$$.   No con's.
Nice easy to play pool game.  Very controler friendly.
i hate this game, but i love pool  79/100

Pool Nation is a fun fantasy pool game but I found frustration outweighed my enjoyment over time due to many small issues. I regularly had an issue where stars in levels would not be awarded after the match when the in-match tracking said I had completed the challange and I had won both the game and match. This lead to completing stars up to four times before the game successfully registered them. Another frustrating but not game breaking issue was that the overhead view became blocked on some levels which left me with only the on table view. This view is enough to play on, but still limited my options. A lot of little things like this detracted from the game for me and lead to me sending it to the done pile earlier than it should have been. I found this game to be worth the money I spent, but still fails to be something I can recommend.
only 9 ball, dont know why
Only one difficulty setting... You will never win.
This game is a serious competitor for Battlefield when it comes to bugs. If they wouldn't exist, it'd be a fun game.

This is an ok game. I wanted to like it because of the great reviews, however sometimes the ball control is dissapointing. Also, the ball color is difficult to distinguish on my laptop and the game frequently does not allow a complete view of the table.

I like this game but I can't recommend it. The graphics are great and it's a well done Pool sim but no matter how many points you have over your opponent, no matter balls you've scored in over your opponent, if your opponent makes the last shot you lose. No matter the scor you lose. I don't believe this is how Pool works or at least from what I read from the official rules of the game. It's a 4/10 for me.
the physics engine is quite nice, but the game looks so ♥♥♥♥ing disgusting that its simply impossible to play it for more than 5 minutes.  also it crashes if you alttab.

The devs have guaranteed there'll be at least one dlc, and it'll be free for people who pre-ordered. Well, where is it now?
No box of trix...no update's...

It's a simulator..... what does that mean?   No fun... very boring gameplay...   They lured me in with a 85% off sale, and a fun looking 'box of tricks' mode that hasn't been included in the game yet.

Couple of my friends bought the game and were having fun so I figured 'what the hell'. Unforunately I couldn't ever get the game to even run. I followed several threads between the DEP fix, all the redistribution installs, disabling eyefinity and lightboost but in the end it still crashed on launch. Take one look at their steam forum, I'm not alone not by a long shot.  Maybe you'll be lucky and it'll work great, you'll have a blast playing alone or with friends. Or you might get unlucky and spend hours trying to fix a game that should just work.  If it's on sale, might be worth the risk. Otherwise don't.
Nope

The physics are all good and the graphics are fine. However...the audio is a disaster. The music is awful but the great news is you can turn it off! Problem solved I hear you say...   Nope.... That just leaves you with the 'Ambient sounds' which seem to be 30 second tracks on a continual loop and you can't turn these off. Shame because it ruins and otherwise mediocre game.   If the devs added a way to turn off the ambient sounds I'd recommend the game.
Decent enough game, but the controls are terrible, and the camera is nearly impossible to position where you actually want it.
